alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 04 at 5:06PM CDT until November 04 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arkansas and northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Arkansas, Benton, Crawford and Washington AR. In northeast Oklahoma, Adair and Delaware. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 504 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Radar estimates of up to 1 inch of rain has already fallen in parts of the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches and locally higher are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville... Springdale... Rogers... Bentonville... Siloam Springs... Jay... Bella Vista... Lowell... Grove... Farmington... Pea Ridge... Prairie Grove... Gentry... Elkins... Tontitown... Gravette... West Fork... Lincoln... Cave Springs... Decatur... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
